Stock Trading in India
Stock Trading in India



Seems like a dot in world stock markets, Indian{" "} {" "} stock market {" "} is growing at a very rapid speed primary because of the growing corporate space and increase in number of investors. Today, a small population of India are investing in mutual funds and understanding the game of risk and return. However, everyone anticipate that it will grow even further and at a much faster pace. Before getting deep in exploring the Indian stock market, let’s first understand what a stock is.

To know about stock trading simulator visit:{" "} {" "} Stock Market Simulator {" "}

Stocks are securities that represents an ownership share in a company. Many companies go public and issue stock to raise capital which they can infuse in their business and even grow bigger. However for investors, stocks are a way of growing their money, making return on their capital and outpace the growing inflation over time.

Now, if{" "} you are a beginner and want to start{" "} trading {" "} but have no idea about how to initiate, you need to first open a trading-cum-demat account with a registered broker of BSE or NSE and link that to your PAN CARD, Bank Account Number, a mobile number and email ID. Requirements of algo trading are: {" "} Requirements of algotrading{" "}

Once these formalities are over, you are eligible to transfer funds from your bank account to the trading account and buy shares of listed companies on BSE or NSE.

What is NSE and BSE?

NSE (National Stock Exchange) and BSE (Bombay Stock Exchange) are stock markets which provide a secure and regulated environment where traders can transact in stocks and other financial instruments with low operational risk. It is regulated by SEBI (Securities and Exchange Board of India) which was formed. in 1992 as an independent authority.

Role of NSE and BSE:

  • 1. Transparency in exchanges
  • 2. Huge Reach
  • 3. Responsible for evaluation of stock prices
  • 4. High Transaction speed
  • 5. Acts as a barometer for a country’s economy
  • 6. Safeguard Investors

When you want to trade, you must have a broker who executes the trades in a market. While choosing a broker, make sure to take care of the following factors:

  • 1. Cost (or Commission)
  • 2. Regulatory Compliance
  • 3. Customer Support
  • 4. Speed of Execution
  • 5. Spreads


Another important thing to know about is market index. A stock market index is a measurement of a section of the stock market. It is computed from the prices of selected stocks. It is a tool used by investors and financial managers to describe the market, and to compare the return on specific investment. The two prominent Indian market indexes are Sensex and Nifty.

Coming to number of traders in India, despite having 1.2 billion population, there are only 20 million active trader accounts in India. Some of the popular traders are Sudarshan Sukhani and Rakesh Jhunjhunwala who are not only making money from stock markets but also helping in expanding it nationwide. India is a fast emerging country with a stable financial market. Many households are thinking of joining the race and start investing in stocks and mutual funds. It is also a great time for foriegn investors to invest heavily in Indian domestic market, which is growing at a very fast pace.

Kuants is constantly making it easier for anyone who is thinking to invest in stocks. You can visit at{" "} https://kuants.in {" "} to know more about us. Start trading, Start investing.
